subject: Psychology
title: Stereotype Threat
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stereotype Threat usable.

hook.text: Tell women a math test shows gender differences and their scores drop. Tell them it doesn't and the gap vanishes.

buildup.text: Stereotype threat is the fear of confirming a negative stereotype about your group, which impairs performance.

discovery.text: Claude Steele showed that merely activating awareness of a stereotype is enough to undermine performance.

twist.text: The effect hits strongest among the most capable and motivated â€” those who care most about performing well.

climax.text: Simple interventions â€” framing tests as non-diagnostic or affirming values â€” can eliminate the effect.

punchline.text: The fear of proving a stereotype true can make it come true.

quiz.question: What is stereotype threat?
options: Fear of confirming a negative stereotype that impairs performance
A method for improving group performance
Stereotypes that are always accurate predictions
